She gained experience as a medical scribe during college. A Knoxville native, she previously served as a gynecologic oncology physician assistant in Northern California but was drawn back home to Knoxville to pursue orthopaedics. In her free time, Ellie enjoys outdoor activities – especially skiing – and spending time with her family.

Caroline loves serving her hometown of Knoxville by providing exceptional care and education to patients. She earned a bachelor’s degree in kinesiology from the University of Kentucky, where she was a member of the dance team for four years. She earned a master’s degree in physician assistant studies from Lincoln Memorial University-DeBusk College of Osteopathic Medicine (LMU-DCOM).

In her spare time, Caroline enjoys walking her dog, Hank, attending University of Tennessee sporting events with her fiancé, Daniel, Sunday night dinners with her family and going to the beach.

Marah Smith draws great satisfaction from helping patients understand how their body works, identifying the cause of their issues and working together to get them back to doing the activities they love. She earned a bachelor’s degree in biochemistry and cellular and molecular biology from the University of Tennessee and a Master of Medical Science in physician assistant studies from Lincoln Memorial University. She is certified by the National Commission on Certification of Physician Assistants (NCCPA) and a member of Tennessee Academy of Physician Assistants and American Academy of Physician Associates. A Knoxville native, she is fulfilling her dream to return to Knoxville Orthopaedic Clinic after previously serving as a medical scribe to help the people in her community. In her free time, she is active in the Knoxville Greek Orthodox community.

Heather Brown enjoys using her skills to help patients from initial evaluation through recovery to help them understand their issues and provide ways to get them back to a better quality of life. She earned a bachelor’s degree in human physiology from the University of Oregon, a master’s degree in athletic training from University of Tennessee at Chattanooga, a Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) from Lincoln Memorial University and Master of Science in Nursing-Family Nurse Practitioner (MSN-FNP) from Frontier Nursing University. She is certified by the American Association of Nurse Practitioners (AANP). She enjoys spending time with her family, including her husband, two young children and two dogs as well as traveling and all types of sports.

Kristen, who was born and raised in Knoxville, earned her undergraduate degree in kinesiology from The University of Tennessee where she was on the rowing team for four years.

She earned her Master of Physician Assistant Studies from Lipscomb University in Nashville and enjoys assisting with the variety of medical conditions that are treated at the clinic and being there for her patients. Whether it is educating her patients or discussing their diagnosis and treatment options, she truly enjoys helping people get back to their everyday lives symptom free.

Kristen also wants to continue to make a positive impact on all her patients and the Knoxville community. In her free time, Kristen loves traveling, hiking in the Smoky Mountains, spending time with friends and family and cheering on her beloved Tennessee Volunteers.

Grahm, who was born and raised in Knoxville, earned his undergraduate degree in kinesiology from the University of Tennessee. He earned a Master of Physician Assistant Studies from Lincoln Memorial University in Knoxville. In his work with Knoxville Orthopaedic Clinic, he sees patients, gives injections and assists Dr. Brian Dilworth in surgery. He enjoys working with patients to find the best treatment plans, so they can get back to doing what they love. In his spare time, Grahm enjoys spending time with his wife, Elizabeth, trying new restaurants and going to the beach. He also enjoys cooking, golf and playing pickleball.

Christie Snow is a certified nurse practitioner (NP-C) who identifies and treats orthopaedic issues while educating patients by promoting overall health and wellness. She found her passion in orthopaedics and advanced her education to improve patients’ quality of care and quality of life.

Christie earned a Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) degree and a Master of Science in Nursing (MSN) from Tennessee Tech University. She is certified by the American Academy of Nurse Practitioners (AANP).

An Oak Ridge native, she considers it a privilege to be able to serve her community. In her free time, she enjoys outdoor activities – especially hiking – and spending time with her husband and two daughters.

Anna was born and raised in Chattanooga, Tennessee. After earning a Bachelor of Science in Kinesiology at Abilene Christian University in Abilene, Texas, she went on to attend Lincoln Memorial University in Harrogate, Tennessee and graduated with a Master of Medical Science in Physician Assistant Studies. Anna grew up around athletics which made the field of orthopaedics a natural fit for her career as a physician assistant.

In her free time, Anna enjoys cycling, hiking, and playing with her Labrador Retriever, Scout.

Katelyn has had a passion for the medical field since a young age and decided early to pursue a career in nursing. After working as a registered nurse for a couple years, Katelyn returned to school at Vanderbilt University for her master’s degree and became a family nurse practitioner. She enjoys interacting with patients and providing them with education and high-quality care.

Outside of work, Katelyn enjoys spending time with her husband and daughter, including hiking, playing sports and getting outdoors.

Kristen enjoys being a part of her patients’ journey from start to finish. As a member of the spine team, she works in collaboration with a physician to help formulate a plan of care for each patient as an individual by performing assessments, interpreting diagnostics and creating a course of action.

In the office, Kristen helps patients understand their condition through education and providing them with appropriate treatment options to help manage this. In the operating room, she assists the surgeon during the procedure to help fix the underlying condition in real time.

When she’s not working, Kristen spends time with her husband, Austin, and her two children, Natalie and Connor. She love being outdoors, playing basketball, and watching sports.

Jared Orick is a certified nurse practitioner (NP-C) who evaluates and treats a wide range of orthopaedic issues ranging from injuries to chronic arthritis. His goal is to provide a high level of care while helping patients.

Jared earned a Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) degree and a Master of Science in Nursing, Family Nurse Practitioner (MSN-FNP) from Tennessee Tech University. He is certified by the American Academy of Nurse Practitioners (AANP).

In his free time, he enjoys spending time with his son, Jacob, working out, playing basketball and seeking new adventures – especially through travel.

After seven years of 12-hour shifts as a nurse in the ICU, Erin understands foot pain. She’s always been interested in orthopedics and is eager to provide relief options and treatment plans for patients’ everyday foot and ankle pain.

After earning her bachelor’s degree in nursing from Tennessee Wesleyan, Erin went on to King University for her master’s degree and became a family nurse practitioner. She works with Dr. Short and Dr. Davidson to help patients with foot or ankle pain, fractures or sprains. Erin is passionate about educating her patients. She wants people to walk out of the clinic knowing all of their options and with all of their questions answered.

Erin finds joy in her son, Noah, and her two dogs, Moose and Mowgli. She enjoys running, spending her weekends outside whenever possible and exploring new local restaurants and breweries with her husband, Andrew.

Kadison (Kadie) has always been passionate about providing quality patient care to those in need. She received her undergraduate degree in exercise science with a minor in biology from Truman State University in Kirksville, Missouri. She graduated magna cum laude and played college softball, which helped shape her passion for orthopedics and sports medicine. After earning her bachelor’s degree, she worked as a patient care technician in organ transplant for a year in Charleston, South Carolina.

Kadie then earned her Master of Health Science in Physician Assistant Studies from South College in Knoxville and joined the team at University Orthopedic Surgeons shortly thereafter at the start of 2022. Kadie strives to provide excellent orthopedic care in the outpatient clinic and urgent injury care settings.

In her spare time, Kadie enjoys visiting her family and the beach, catching Vols games with friends, skiing, golfing, playing tennis and keeping up with her cat, Luna.

Education & Training

  • Bachelor of Science in Exercise Science, Truman State University, Kirksville, Missouri
  • Master of Health Science in Physician Assistant Studies, South College, Knoxville, Tennessee

Certification

  • National Commission on Certification of Physician Assistants

Rachel Walker is a certified physician assistant (PA-C) who has clinical experience in multiple orthopedic specialties, including sports medicine, foot/ankle, shoulder/elbow and hand/wrist. She received a bachelor’s degree from The University of Tennessee in education with a kinesiology major in 2016 and earned a master’s degree in physician assistant studies from South College in 2019.

Rachel is certified by the National Commission on Certification of Physician Assistants (NCCPA) and a current member of the American Academy of Physician Assistants and Tennessee Academy of Physician Assistants. She diagnoses and treats patients at OrthoTennessee Maryville, working with orthopaedic surgeons as part of a medical team. In her free time, Rachel enjoys spending time at the lake, traveling and Tennessee Vols football and basketball games.

Originally from Ringgold, Georgia, Tyler has always had a strong desire to treat patients with orthopaedic problems, which stems from his own athletic background. He received his undergraduate degree in kinesiology from the University of Tennessee at Knoxville and earned his Master of Science in Physician Assistant Studies from South University in Savannah, Georgia. While at Tennessee, he worked as a student athletic trainer for the Lady Volunteers and has also worked as a physical therapy technician. Tyler enjoys treating musculoskeletal injuries and helping patients regain function in order to perform the activities they love.

In his spare time, Tyler enjoys spending time with his wife, Kate. They enjoy playing outside with their dogs, traveling, music and Tennessee football games. Tyler diagnoses and treats patients at OrthoTennessee Maryville, where he works alongside orthopaedic surgeons as part of a medical team. He is a current member of the American Academy of Physician Assistants.

Lori was raised in Knoxville and graduated from The University of Tennessee with a degree in education/kinesiology. She earned a master’s degree in exercise and sports science with a concentration in athletic training at the University of Florida. She then attended Wake Forest University School of Medicine for her physician assistant degree. She enjoys the opportunity to help KOC patients solve issues that cause pain or limit activities. Outside of work, Lori loves spending time with her friends and family. She enjoys the people, culture, food, climate and landscape this area provides. She also enjoys doing yard work, gardening and spending time on the water.

Kevin graduated from Knoxville Catholic High School and then earned his undergraduate degree in exercise science from UT Chattanooga. He went to PA school at Barry University in Miami Shores, Florida. He enjoys helping people by finding the correct diagnosis and treatment plan for them. He doesn’t want his patients to leave with more questions than answers. In his spare time, Kevin likes to golf, fish, camp and travel with his family.

Jenna is a Knoxville native who attended Lincoln Memorial University for both her undergraduate and graduate nursing degrees. In her role with KOC, Jenna collaborates with the physicians to help ensure a successful treatment plan that gets each patient back to their best self. Her favorite part of her job is helping people in all different ways - whether it be relieving their pain, answering their questions or just taking a moment to truly listen to their needs. She wants to help make a positive difference in the lives of all her patients. In her free time, you can find Jenna trying new restaurants, traveling or cuddling with her goldendoodle Millie!

William Short earned his bachelor’s degree in kinesiology from The University of Tennessee. He then attended Lincoln Memorial University-DeBusk College of Osteopathic Medicine in Harrogate, Tennessee,

William earned his Bachelor of Science in kinesiology from The University of Tennessee. He then attended Lincoln Memorial University–DeBusk College of Osteopathic Medicine in Harrogate, Tennessee, where he received his Master of Medical Science. William was raised in East Tennessee and has a passion for providing care for others.

In his free time, William is an avid outdoor adventurer and enjoys hiking, wakeboarding, wakesurfing, snowboarding, playing golf and scuba diving.

Education & Training

  • Master of Medical Science: Lincoln Memorial University–DeBusk College of Osteopathic Medicine, Harrogate, Tennessee

Christy was raised in Knoxville, Tennessee, and earned her bachelor's degree in 2006 and master's degree in 2008 from The University of Tennessee Knoxville in genetics and biotechnology. She then moved to Nashville and attended Trevecca Nazarene University, where she earned an additional master's degree in medicine and physician assistant studies in 2011. She works alongside Dr. Anna Wallace in the hospital, clinical and OR settings, managing primary and metastatic bony and soft tissue tumors.

She has three beautiful children and a Goldendoodle named Luna. When they are not busy with school and sports, they enjoy going to the park, hiking, traveling, hanging out with family and cheering on the Vols.

Mandee became a physician assistant to further her skills in medicine. She was previously an athletic trainer at a local high school, and decided she wanted to have an even bigger impact in the community.

Mandee received her undergraduate degree from High Point University and master’s degrees from both Columbus State University and South College. In her work with KOC, she sees patients, gives injections and assists Dr. Sherrell in surgery. She enjoys getting to know her patients and having the ability to keep their joints working for as long as they need them.

In her leisure time, Mandee enjoys traveling, cooking and writing about food and the local restaurant scene. She is married with two dogs who keep her on her toes.

Benjamin Wendel enjoys the hands-on patient care he provides in healthcare. He graduated from The University of Tennessee with a bachelor’s degree in biochemistry and cellular and molecular biology and continued to Lincoln Memorial University-DeBusk College of Osteopathic Medicine to earn his master’s in physician assistant studies. He provides patient care in both the hospital and clinic settings as an extension of the physicians and also assists in the operating room as needed.

In his spare time, Benjamin enjoys spending time with his wife and kids outdoors. He is a sports enthusiast and a diehard UT fan. His family attends Cornerstone Church of Knoxville, and professionally, he is a member of American Academy of Physician Assistants, Physician Assistants in Orthopaedic Surgery and Tennessee Academy of Physician Assistants.

Dylan Rathbone is from Maryville, Tennessee, and he earned his bachelor’s degree from The University of Tennessee. During his undergrad, he started his journey in medicine by working as a certified nursing assistant at UT Medical Center in orthopaedics. Dylan decided to continue a career in medicine as a physician assistant. He graduated from Mercer University with a Master of Medical Science, and he became a member of University Orthopaedic Surgeons in 2021. Dylan currently serves patients in the emergency department, operating room and within the hospital. 

In his free time, Dylan enjoys several activities such as snowboarding, watersports, grilling for cookouts, traveling and spending time with his friends and family.

Dana Pelizza, originally from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, joined University Orthopaedic Surgeons in 2009. She received her master’s degree in physician assistant studies from Chatham University in Pittsburgh after attending Pennsylvania State University in State College, Pennsylvania, for her undergraduate degrees. She works alongside Dr. Philip McDowell, assisting him in the operating room and caring for patients in the hospital and clinic settings.

In her free time, Dana enjoys spending time with her husband and stepson, watching and playing sports and traveling to visit friends and family.

EDUCATION & TRAINING

  • Bachelor of Science in biological science and psychology: Pennsylvania State University, State College, Pennsylvania
  • Master of Physician Assistant Studies: Chatham University, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

Brad Moore originally is from Austin, Texas, but has proudly called East Tennessee home since 1989. After earning his bachelor’s degree in psychology from The University of Tennessee in 2004, he worked with individuals with developmental disabilities before deciding to return to school to become a physician assistant. He received his master’s degree in physician assistant studies in 2011 from South College in Knoxville. 

Brad joined University Orthopaedic Surgeons in 2012 as a member of the joint replacement team, where he primarily assists in the operating room and manages the care of patients in the hospital after surgery. 

Brad enjoys photography, hiking, playing guitar, UT sports and especially spending his time off with his wife, Christy, and their daughter, Kaylee. 

EDUCATION & TRAINING 

  • Bachelor of Arts in psychology: The University of Tennessee, Knoxville, Tennessee 
  • Master of Health Science in physician assistant studies: South College, Knoxville, Tennessee

As a physician assistant, Hannah Maus feels blessed to be able to serve and provide patients with high-quality healthcare. She earned her bachelor’s degree from Lee University in Cleveland, Tennessee, graduating magna cum laude. Hannah worked as a medical scribe for several years before attending Lincoln Memorial University-DeBusk College of Osteopathic Medicine in Harrogate, Tennessee, where she received her master’s degree in physician assistant studies. She has a strong passion for the field of orthopaedics as well as for serving others.

Hannah resides in Maryville with her husband and enjoys being part of the local community.

EDUCATION & TRAINING

  • Bachelor of Science: Lee University, Cleveland, Tennessee
  • Master of Medical Science, Physician Assistant Studies: Lincoln Memorial University-DeBusk College of Osteopathic Medicine, Harrogate, Tennessee

After getting his bachelor’s degree from The University of Tennessee, Matthew Labelle spent two years working for University Orthopaedic Surgeons before returning to school to pursue his master’s degree in physician assisting. He always had a strong passion for orthopaedics and was eager to work in orthopaedic trauma after finishing school.

In addition to his work, he enjoys the outdoors, cooking, gardening and spending time with his friends and family. He spends most of his free time hiking, fishing or going to the lake with his wife.

Justin Fugate earned his bachelor’s degree in biology from Lincoln Memorial University in Harrogate, Tennessee. He then attended Lincoln Memorial University-DeBusk College of Osteopathic Medicine, where he received his Master of Medical Science. 

Justin is from Rogersville, Tennessee, and is proud to call East Tennessee home. In his free time, he enjoys going to the gym, hiking and taking his dog to the park. 

EDUCATION & TRAINING 

  • Bachelor of Science, biology: Lincoln Memorial University, Harrogate, Tennessee 
  • Master of Medical Science, physician assistant studies: Lincoln Memorial University-DeBusk College of Osteopathic Medicine, Harrogate, Tennessee

David Erpenbach was born and raised in Knoxville and received his undergraduate degree from The University of Tennessee in 2009. He earned his master’s degree in physician assistant studies at South College in 2012 and has been working as an orthopaedic physician assistant ever since. He now works closely with Dr. Brian Tonne in the hospital, operating room and clinic settings.

In his free time, David enjoys spending time with his wife and son and being outdoors, whether he’s running, hiking, biking or playing soccer. He is an avid Vols fan and tries to attend home football and basketball games whenever possible.

EDUCATION & TRAINING

  • Bachelor of Science in education, exercise science: The University of Tennessee, Knoxville, Tennessee

Jamie has always had a passion for anatomy and physiology, and while completing X-ray training, she determined that a career on the front lines of patient care was the right choice. She embraces the responsibility and challenge of both diagnosing and treating patients. With an undergraduate in radiation services from The University of Iowa, Jamie went on to earn her master's in health sciences from South College and joined the team at University Orthopaedic Surgeons shortly thereafter.

Jamie spends much of her time treating patients in the hospital recovering from surgery following a traumatic event. She enjoys following up with patients when they return to the clinic to share in the progress they have made through recovery. In her spare time, Jamie enjoys all things outdoors—running, biking, hiking, and being near the water.

EDUCATION & TRAINING 

  • Bachelor of Science, radiation sciences: The University of Iowa, Iowa City, Iowa 
  • Master of Health Science, physician assistant studies: South College, Knoxville, Tennessee

Donna Kailey Akins is from Loudon, Tennessee, and always has been proud to call East Tennessee home. She graduated magna cum laude with a Bachelor of Science in biology health sciences from Tennessee Tech University. During undergrad, Kailey started her journey in the medical field while working as a patient care associate at Cookeville Regional Medical Center.

After graduating, she moved to Knoxville and worked in the imaging department and breast center at Parkwest Medical Center. Kailey felt her previous medical experiences helped shape her passion for working closely with patients and ensuring she is on the front lines of quality healthcare.

She decided to pursue a career as a physician assistant and graduated in 2020 from South College with a master’s degree in physician assistant studies.

Kailey joined University Orthopaedic Surgeons in 2021 as a member of the trauma orthopaedics team where she serves patients in the emergency department, operating room and within the hospital.

On her days off, she enjoys catching up with her friends and family, soaking up the sun on the lake, cheering on the Vols and cuddling with her two dogs, Shiloh and Ziva.

EDUCATION & TRAINING

  • Bachelor of Science in biology health sciences, Tennessee Technological University, Cookeville, Tennessee
  • Master of Health Science in physician assistant studies, South College, Knoxville, Tennessee

CERTIFICATION

  • National Commission on Certification of Physician Assistants

Upon graduating with a nursing degree from The University of Tennessee, Rinnah Sunico wanted to advance her skills in providing orthopaedic and trauma care to her patients. She continued her education receiving multiple degrees, and most recently earned a master’s in nursing degree specializing in adult gerontological primary care. In her role with University Orthopaedic Surgeons, she works closely with patients during their hospital stays, providing acute care for orthopaedic and comprehensive health needs. Rinnah is an active member of the National Association of Orthopaedic Nurses and the Tennessee Nurses Association.

EDUCATION & TRAINING

  • Master of Science Nursing: The University of Tennessee, Knoxville, Tennessee

Ilsa Jones, originally from northwest Oregon, relocated to Knoxville after deciding to pursue a bachelor’s degree in exercise science from The University of Tennessee. After receiving her Master of Science in nursing from Marquette University in 2014, she returned to her adopted home of Knoxville.

Her experience with orthopaedic patients started well before nursing as a student athletic trainer with the Lady Volunteers. From there, she continued to pursue supporting aspects of surgery, including personal training, inpatient rehab and critical care surgery. Alongside Dr. Joshua Moss, Ilsa continues to support patients in the hospital, operating room and clinical settings. Free time is spent predominately with her husband and two dogs as she continues to cheer on her Oregon Ducks while living in Big Orange Country.

EDUCATION & TRAINING

  • Bachelor of Science in education, exercise science: The University of Tennessee, Knoxville, Tennessee
  • Master of Science Nursing: Marquette University, Milwaukee, Wisconsin

A deep desire to help others inspired Chanell Salage to become an advanced practitioner. She appreciates the opportunity to positively impact patient outcomes and helping patients meet healthcare goals.

Chanell is board certified as a family nurse practitioner (FNP-BC) by American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) and is a member of American Association of Nurse Practitioners (AANP). She earned an associate degree in nursing from Roane State Community College; and both a Bachelor of Science in nursing (BSN) and Master of Science in Nursing family nurse practitioner (MSN FNP) from King University. She and her husband, Eric, have one daughter and a boxer named Cash, and you’ll find her enjoying adventures with family and friends, hiking, running and watching college football in her free time.

Cassy was born and raised in East Tennessee. She received her undergraduate degree at Middle Tennessee State University. She then earned her master's degree in Physician Assistant studies at the University of South Alabama. She has been working as a physician assistant in orthopedics ever since. She enjoys being part of the shoulder team both in clinic and assisting Dr. Holloway in the operating room. In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her family and cheering on the Vols.

Kate has been at KOC since 2015 and currently works with the sports medicine team. Originally from Paris, Tennessee, she received her undergraduate degree in psychology from the University of Tennessee at Knoxville and earned her Master of Science in Physician Assistant Studies from South University in Savannah, Georgia. Her love for Knoxville brought her back after she graduated. Kate loves being a part of the medical team at KOC and seeing patients get back to the activities they love. She is a member of the American Academy of Physician Assistants. For fun, Kate enjoys spending time with her family.

Robert is a nurse practitioner with more than 30 years of experience in the operating room, emergency room and orthopaedic clinic. An active child, his first trip to an orthopaedist sparked an interest in studying human anatomy and the musculoskeletal system. Robert enjoys meeting his patients from all walks of life and helping them regain pain-free function. In his spare time, he enjoys mountain biking, weight training and walking his family’s dachshund around the park.

Amy completed her Master of Health Science in Physician Assistant Studies from South College in 2012. She accepted her first job as a PA with KOC and has been with the company ever since. Before becoming a PA, she received her bachelor’s degree from the University of Tennessee and also has worked as an EMT-IV, personal trainer, student athletic trainer and physical therapy technician. Stationed primarily at our north office Injury Clinic, she is able to combine these backgrounds to better serve patients of all ages with acute problems. Outside of work, Amy loves spending time with her wife and two kids. You can find them enjoying an array of activities from camping and boating to trying new restaurants, cheering on the Vols or attending concerts and shows at the Tennessee Theatre.

Brandon was born and raised in Knoxville and played tennis for the University of Tennessee. He earned his master’s degree from South College. He wanted to become a PA to promote health and wellness in his community. Brandon describes his job as a collaborative member within a highly trained and specialized team of orthopaedic providers striving to provide the highest quality of care to patients. He really enjoys helping people return to their pre-injury hobbies and interests. When he’s not working, Brandon enjoys running, golfing, and spending time with his wife, daughter and dog.

Richard’s love of medicine started on a humanitarian trip to Bolivia. Since then, he's always been passionate about helping the injured. He enjoys helping patients regain function in order to perform the activities they love. Richard received his bachelor’s degree from the University of Texas and his master’s from the University of Nebraska. He also proudly served in the U.S. Army for 21 years. In his free time, Richard loves biking, hiking, traveling and photography, in addition to spending time with his children and granddaughter.

Ben has had a passion for the medical field since childhood. He had the opportunity to make a career change later in life and found the physician assistant track was the perfect fit.

He received his Master of Physician Assistant Studies from South College in Knoxville and has been working at KOC since 2014. He enjoys all aspects of his job, whether educating patients in the clinic or assisting a surgeon in the operating room.

In his free time, Ben loves doing anything outdoors – cycling, hiking, camping. He’s happily married to his wife Beth and they are the proud parents of four children. His church family and community are a big part of his life as well.

Jeff is a physician assistant originally from East Tennessee. He had a life-changing experience in California years ago when he helped an elderly woman who was choking. Since then, he always wanted to pursue a career in medicine so he could help people for a living. He attended Augusta State University in Georgia for his undergraduate training and completed his physician assistant degree at South University in Savannah. Jeff is a member of the American Academy of Physician Assistants and the Tennessee Association of Physician Assistants. Jeff currently works with Dr. Spencer in our Shoulder and Elbow Center. Not only does he see patients in the clinic, he also assists Dr. Spencer in the operating room and is involved in research. He and Dr. Spencer pride themselves on giving above-standard care and informing all of their patients about what to expect before, during, and after surgery. The team approach at KOC is second to none. Jeff lives in Knoxville with his wife, Rebecca, and their three sons. He enjoys golfing, fishing and snow and water skiing.

Brandi is a nurse practitioner working with KOC’s three spine surgeons. Originally from Sevierville, she graduated from The University of Tennessee with a degree in nursing and then got her master’s degree at Carson-Newman University. She has a background in emergency room and surgical nursing.

In addition to evaluating new spine patients in the office, Brandi assists the team in coordinating their care and educating them about their diagnosis and treatment options. She enjoys being able to spend time with her patients in order to fully explain the problem and answer their questions.

In her free time, Brandi likes to kayak, try new restaurants and relax with friends and family.

Brandi is a member of the American Association of Nurse Practitioners and the North American Spine Society.

Before becoming a nurse practitioner, Hannah was an ER nurse at East Tennessee Children’s Hospital for 10 years. She received her Master of Science in Nursing from Carson-Newman University. She enjoys being able to provide hands-on treatment and relief to her patients. When she's not working, Hannah likes to travel and spend time with her husband, their daughter and their dogs.

A veteran healthcare provider, Barry has long felt a call toward patient care and has enjoyed working with people in a number of medical settings. He earned his undergraduate degree from Trevecca Nazarene University in Nashville and a Master of Science in Physician Assistant Studies from the University of Nebraska in Omaha. Barry has been a Certified Physician Assistant for more than 20 years. For 10 years, he served as a captain in the Medical Specialty Corps of the US Army Reserve.

As part of the KOC team, Barry manages the Injury Clinic at the Fort Sanders West location. He especially enjoys interacting with patients and offering a high quality of care at a time of day when that's difficult to find. Barry and his wife, Ellen, live in Maryville with their youngest son, Zachary. Their oldest son, Lance, lives in Knoxville with his family. In his leisure time, Barry enjoys fishing.
